Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you know that in Morocco it is common to exchange a small gift when meeting somebody for the first time? In Japan you must always commit suicide to avoid embarrassment. In Italy you must always wash your hands after going to the bathroom. This is considered to be polite.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why are you telling us this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am jetting off on an international business trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To Can-A-da.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Canada.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My boss is sending me abroad to do a presentation to an international client and I have always been intrigued by all things international. The women, the pancakes, the man of mystery...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith, I would like you to pretend that you are from Abu Dhabi.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [British accent] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am ashamed at your naked face. I must cover it with my jacket. [covers Meredith's face with his jacket] You are now sexy in your culture.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: T minus...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Six point five days. [winces as Kevin smacks him on the back]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [walks up behind Jim and puts his hands on his shoulders] One more week.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam comes back from New York next week and everyone here has just been so excited for me. And involved. And intrusive. And weird.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: On more week. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Heh heh. [Jim gives camera an odd look]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Do you have your passport?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have my passport. [pats jacket pocket]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Got your per diem?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have my per diem. [holds up money] I already know what I am going to spend this on. I am going to buy a sweater.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Michael, the... that's for your food.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well I'll just... I'll use different money for that.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I was happy to send Michael on this trip. He's been feeling pretty down since we had to transfer Holly up to New Hampshire. But this little perk really seemed to turn him around. [chuckling] And it's pretty tough to find somebody who wants to go up to Winnipeg mid-November.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And business class air, like a five-star hotel in the sky, nothing but the best. Actually better than a five-star hotel 'cause you get a big, cushy seat and you sit in a row of people and to eat, whatever the mind can imagine. I think I am going to have a filet with mushroom sauce.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Well, I'm just glad to know you're happy because you know I felt bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well that is all in the past.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: And in terms of nightlife, when you get there just ask the concierge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They have one of those?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in a singsong voice] Lets do this!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, why do you need three suitcases?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Two are for souvenirs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you have your money belt?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do. It's right here. [indicates to waist]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. You want to wear that puppy right up on the breastbone like a bra. [demonstrates]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't want to wear a bra.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here, let me help you. [reaches for Michael's money belt]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it! Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you want to get robbed in a foreign country? I wash my hands of this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Where is my translator?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Monsieur.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm just bidding a bon voyage a La Mon Petit fiancee. Translation:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on airplane] Welcome to Cribs-the business class edition. Check this out. Mimosa.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah... sweet!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Handed to me as I sat down. This was my hot towel. It is still wet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael Gary Scott rolling like a pimp!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Take a sip of that. [hands Andy his mimosa]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmmhmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That good?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't drink all of it. Give some to Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's really good. [offers mimosa to Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You want one of your own? I can hook you up.

Quote.Speaker: Stewardess
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. You'll need to keep moving.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, this is Beth. This is my personal valet/flight attendant and she will be helping me this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Beth
Quote.Text: We need to keep the isle clear.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get back, get back. Come on, get back to the slums.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh boy. [follows Oscar back to coach]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whisper] Hey... guys, check it out. My own personal DVD player and 20 movies.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispers] Andy brought one too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [loudly] Harry and the Henderson's

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhhh! Keep it down.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I made egg salad sandwiches. Do you want one? [holds up sandwich]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could you have picked something stinkier to bring on a plane? [Andy laughs] My God, Oscar. Really? Do you have a bag of baby poop in there too, to share with everybody? No, I will be ordering my own food, thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to stewardess] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Beth
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um. I'd like to see a menu please.

Quote.Speaker: Beth
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. There are no meals on flights less than two hours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... okay. [looks back at Andy and Oscar] Doesn't matter, because I am going to take a nap. I think I am going to use my complimentary blindfold. I will don it... and oh! Look at that. I can't see because I am in a- [cart crashes into Michael's leg] GAH!

Quote.Speaker: Beth
Quote.Text: What would you like to drink?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [walks into Kelly's cubicle and sets a box down on the desk] Just checking out where I'm going to be pretty soon. When Pam gets back. Gonna be close quarters. Gonna be a lot of tension.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: For you. I'm with Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This looks like where I'll probably do my pushups every day. [gets on floor and starts doing pushups]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Is that supposed to impress me? [Ryan starts trying to do one-armed pushups]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [talking head] No. Not going to happen. He has hurt me too much and too often. And I am in a healthy relationship so I'm not gonna flaunt it and I'm not gonna hurt him, but that door is closed.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [making out with Ryan on her desk] What are we doing? This is so wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah... Mmmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [going up escalator in the hotel] This is nice. This is nice. Move in here. Very sweet... ah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll check us in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Very cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very cool.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We are going to find out where the action is, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where's the concierge?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! Wallace said there would be one of those.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmm... bingo! [indicates towards concierge desk] Follow moi, bro-sieur.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to concierge] What about a nice sushi place? Maybe a place with a view?

Quote.Speaker: Concierge
Quote.Text: Tsk... Oh. Matsuki. That's a good one. Uh, you may walk there if you wish or you man take the number seventeen bus until 9:00. Other than that you can take the taxi and the number is right there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow! Wow, I am blown away by this. I, um... I-ah! This is great, thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One final question. Where might you find yourself on a Winnipeg night like tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Concierge
Quote.Text: Oh, the Huntsman is good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [nodding towards Michael] The Huntsman.

Quote.Speaker: Concierge
Quote.Text: Down here... the financial district.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A concierge is like the Winnipeg equivalent of a geisha. This is a woman who has been trained in the fine art of fanciness and pleasure. And when you meet one, it is intoxicating. Just what the doctor ordered.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [at school in NYC] Can't believe this. [pulls out cell phone... sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in office] Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over the phone] I just talked to my advisor. Failing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. I thought you were good at Flash.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was, and then they switched to Acrobat just as I was learning Quark. I hate computers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, it's no big deal. So you're not a computer geek.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have to stay and retake it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks shocked] W--Wow. Um. Well... okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That means another twelve weeks. [pause] Can you do this for another three months?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not-- It's not about me. I mean, this your dream.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over phone] I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And you went to New York to do this. So when you come back you come back the right way. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [starting to cry] Right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [concerned look on face] You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over phone] Yeah I'm fine. Um... my cell phone battery's low, so I have to let you go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [over phone] Love you. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Love you too. [hangs up phone, Pam sits on a bench crying]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, she's in there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Engaging wings [imitates mechanical sound]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm probably going to leave after one drink.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah with a hot slab of Canadian bacon in your hand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [goes up to concierge from the hotel] Excuse me, hello. Concierge Marie. Michael Scott. Good to see you again.

Quote.Speaker: Marie
Quote.Text: Good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, this is my associate uh, from Dunder Mifflin, uh, Oscar Martinez.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you. [shakes Marie's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Marie
Quote.Text: Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Works in accounting. This is uh, concierge Marie...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...who works at our hotel. You look, how do you say, radiant tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Marie
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And it is, how do you say, a beautiful night--

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's foreign. I am-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: For Madame et monsieur. [hands Michael and Marie a glass of wine]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Marie
Quote.Text: Thank you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let me get a picture of you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone is going to end up dying someday. And I think it's better to die with people you like... like Oscar, and Andy, and concierge Marie... than to know that there's somebody out there that you love that you're not with.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, I've scoped out the joint. Those two dudes are as good as naked.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How do you even know they're gay?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on! It's Dandy Dale and Foppy McGee over there. [turns to bartender] Mademoiselle! Beer me dos Long Island iced teas s'ill vous plait. [to Oscar] Bad decision in a glass.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't care if you're gay, straight, engaged... whatever. A guy needs intercourse.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You'll thank me when they spank thee.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Don't do this. [watches Andy take drinks to the other table]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you guys like apples?

Quote.Speaker: Guy at table
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you like apples?

Quote.Speaker: Guy at table
Quote.Text: Uh, sorry... what?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, how do you like these apples? [sets drinks on table] Alright, on a scale of 1 - 10, how hot is that dude? [indicates towards Oscar who waves slightly]

Quote.Speaker: Guy at table
Quote.Text: Is he your boyfriend or something?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, but he could be yours if you play your cards right.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Dude, leave us alone alright?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gentleman. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dude, you struck out. They're totally stuck up. Here... drink up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How about this one? It's Christmas eve--

Quote.Speaker: Concierge Marie
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: --and everything's closed and you need to get some dry cleaning done. 12:00 midnight. Where do you go? What do you do? What do you do? Come on! What do you do?

Quote.Speaker: Marie
Quote.Text: Uh...A stro cleaners on St. Johns place is the only place open on that day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Unbelievable! Unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: If you don't mind me asking--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Anything. You can ask me anything.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm your wingman.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Its just that I've sat next to Angela for a very long, very long time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right-o.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How could anyone stand that woman?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What do you see in her? Wh -- what do you see in Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do I see in Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I see through a hard exterior to a little jelly in the middle. She is teaching me to be a better person. And she's working really hard on that. And she has the softest skin I've ever seen and I can't wait to have sex with her.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You haven't had sex?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Y-Are you guys waiting to get married, or?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Honestly, I don't know what we're waiting for.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy, something is wrong with that woman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What is wrong with her?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'd like to know. You should call her and ask her. I'd like to know what's wrong with her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I should call her and ask her. What is wrong with her?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do it! It's a-- Call her! [Andy holds up phone] Oh my God, don't call her! Don't call her, Andy. [giggling] Andy, don't call her!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Too late, too late. It's dialing... now it's ringing. [Oscar laughs] Shh...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello? Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why won't you do Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was Oscar and he wants to know why you won't do me and I think it's a valid question.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you drunk?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is Andy Bernard!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know who this is!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wanna take you to sex school.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [over phone] Who is that monkey?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is somebody there?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you drunk?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I have needs.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We will discuss this later.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Naked.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We'll discuss it later naked. I want to see you naked.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing outside hotel room... whispering] Do you want to get some breakfast or something?

Quote.Speaker: Concierge Marie
Quote.Text: I am so tired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [noticing that everyone is giving him a sympathetic look] How does everyone know already?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Know what?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Pam failed art school.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, well, doesn't surprise me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you seen her painting, Jim? The building? There are shadows coming from two different directions.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight, stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Are there two suns?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Last I checked, that's not an office building in the Andromeda galaxy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna grab a cup of coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's totally unrealistic. There are no lines in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oscar

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was fun last night.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, it's true what they say-- Long Island iced teas are way stronger in Canada.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, um... thanks for trying to hook me up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You kidding me? It's what I do. Get the whole nine 'nards. [Oscar laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can't believe we called her up. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Totally. [continues laughing] What-- Who?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm talking about Angela. I can't believe we called her up last night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We called Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You-- you call-- you called her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was real?! I thought I dreamed that. Oh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So bad!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good morning, Michael. [Michael approaches table] Are you ready for the meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Slept like a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Mmmm.... mmm. This can't happen again.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This has to happen again. Darryl can't happen again. Look at me. Do you want me to do more push-ups?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay. You have to break up with Darryl. I already typed out a text message for you. All you have to do is press "send".

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know. I mean, it's well-written and all, I just--

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Has to be done. We'll press send together. [phone beeps]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God. He's going to kill us.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd like to see him try. [kisses Kelly... cell phone beeps]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh! He says it's cool. [laughs] He said, "It's cool".

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's all he wrote?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's all he wrote.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Can I see it?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Didn't you two date for like a long time?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm. It's like a fairy tale! [grabs Ryan and kisses him] Mmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Client
Quote.Text: I'll be honest with you-- we've been talking with Catalyst Paper. Their prices are better than yours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, people continue to come back to us time and time again because they feel cared for here. They feel respected and they feel that their needs matter. They are treated like human beings. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Client
Quote.Text: Everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh man, she is so pissed. [sitting down by Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Mmm...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's taking us back to first base.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What is first base with Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I get to kiss her forehead. [looks at Oscar] I had a good time hanging out this weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I had a good time too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wingman for life. W.M.F.L

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You up for a chest bump?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Bro hug? [Oscar shakes head... then sticks his hand out and Andy shakes it] Back to basics. I like it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I had to go all the way to Canada to get to know a guy who sits 20 feet away from me. And he's delightful! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey! I just heard you guys made the sale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, we locked him up for two years.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Good, very good. See, told you. Sounds like somebody had a good trip.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Actually the trip sucked.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The trip sucked, David. It blew chunks. It was terrible. It was a bad trip.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did not like the trip. Well, starting with her airport shuttle which was basically just a van.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And business class which was basically just coach. And the hotel which sucked big time.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: The hotel? What, M-- okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was not, it sucked.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I'm sorry to hear the hotel was bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh and thanks for the tip on the concerige. That was great. That was great. That was-- that was a--

Quote.Speaker: Dacvid Walalce
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Hey, hey, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a really good choice.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallcve
Quote.Text: Michael, please lets listen for a second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, David. You listen to me. Why did you send her away? That-- God. You knew I liked her and you just sent her away. And that-- that was a sucky thing to do man.

Quote.Speaker: Dacvid Wallace
Quote.Text: Michael, sometimes--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a really sucky thing to do.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Sometimes, we- [Michael hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why have I stayed at Dunder Mifflin for so long? Certainly not because of the paycheck. 'Cause I could be making more money as a doctor or a professional athlete. I think it's because they respect me. A boss that will not fire you, even though you just tell him off... right to his face... over the hone. That's respect.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You did it, man. [fist bumps Jim] Day one. Congrats.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm coming back the wrong way. [smiles at Jim across the parking lot] It's not because of you. I don't like graphic design. That's it. [laughs] Stop smiling. I really didn't like it. It's just designing logos and stuff.... and I miss Scranton. But it is not because I missed you. I just really wanted to come home... and I know you said to come home the right way, but you can't tell me what to do. Got it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I missed you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I missed you too. [Jim kisses her]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. I need you to make five copies of these. [hands Pam papers]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not going inside.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright. First thing in the morning then.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Welcome back.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: We're back together again baby.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We're back.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: They tried to keep us apart, but they couldnt. It was like destiny.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I-- I realized that for whatever reason I... just couldn't do better than kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [whispers] Yeah.
